item.title: Community bicycle pump broken, 30th July
item.description:
A stainless steel bicycle pump for use by the community is broken and needs repairing. Someone has even written on it that it doesnâ€™t work in permanent pen!

item.title: Buddleia bush overhanging footway down to 4 feet above footway, Holy Trinity Church, 66, Lennard Rd, Penge., 30th July
item.description:
Buddleia bush overhanging footway down to 4 feet above footway, Holy Trinity Church, 66, Lennard Rd, Penge. Restricts footway use, will be a surprise to blind / partially-sighted persons (dry or wet weather) and it also interferes with vehicle exit sightline and safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Lennard Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12 foot long trench and loose gravel, 30th July
item.description:
12 foot long trench in the road. This has caused me to fall from my motorcycle causing significant damage to the controls, fairings, brake lever, hand guard, foot pegs, bars and helmet. I have suffered personal injury to my back, legs and hips. See pictures attached. Could I please be contacted and advised how to make a financial claim against the council

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 298, Erith Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pot hole it at least 4 inches deep and6 inches wide, 30th July
item.description:
This was reported on Monday 28/07 and there is still improvement to the very poor road conditions, to the point that you have to drive around the very poor road surface, the area has not been inspection as there is no BLUE MARKING around the area. Let hope that someone will be able to make the effort to locate and the have this matter escalated to the top of road management agenda. The flyover A2 between the two roundabouts going towards Gravel hill there is two potholes that require attend as it seem that have been temporary repaired but the work is not completed as the potholes have returned and require to have correct them properly repaired to the highway standard. Finally, the government has given funds to the councils to have road surfaces repaired to a suitable road, just not a quick fix, this road surface has to be repaired ASAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bourne Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On bus stop pole in Bromley Rd, eastbound, about 25m W of Albemarle Rd, Shortlands as well as the bus stop flag and route numbers defaced (reported to TfL separately) the 'sharp right hand bend ahead' warning triangle has also been sprayed with brown lines., 30th July
item.description:
On bus stop pole in Bromley Rd, eastbound, about 25m W of Albemarle Rd, Shortlands as well as the bus stop flag and route numbers defaced (reported to TfL separately) the 'sharp right hand bend ahead' warning triangle has also been sprayed with brown lines. NB the right hand bend sign is so weathered, and the red triangle is faded to nothing; please just replace the warning triangle sign.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 228, Bromley Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
